p: As shown in Table 7 and Figure 8, the serum ALT, AST, and ALP activities in CTR group and RU-21 group were significantly lower than those in model group; all p < 0.05. Compared with the RU-21 group, the CTR group showed significantly decreased ALP activity; p < 0.05. However, there was no significant difference between the RU-21 group and the CTR group in AST. The results showed that CTR reduced the serum ALT, AST, and ALP activities in mice models of acute alcoholism.
